title: Industrial production down 1.6 percent, but it’s not all bad news
description:
Brazil’s industrial production fell 1.6 percent in January compared to the previous month, the national statistics institute IBGE reported today. The result was driven by a decline in four of the 25 segments surveyed: manufacturing of clothing and accessories, textile products, extractive industries, and food.  These last two segments had grown in the previous months […]

The post Industrial production down 1.6 percent, but it’s not all bad news appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Lula smears Venezuelan opposition, compares it to Bolsonaro’s putschism
description:
President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva met with Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez on Wednesday and used the event to send several foreign policy messages.  He told reporters that Venezuela “knows” it must hold “democratic” elections, which he hopes will convince the U.S. to end sanctions against the country. Lula added that he “hopes” the […]

The post Lula smears Venezuelan opposition, compares it to Bolsonaro’s putschism appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Explaining Brazil #283: Why you should care about Brazil’s Cerrado
description:
The Cerrado has a strategic significance beyond Brazil: no other biome has such a key role to play in furthering food security while simultaneously protecting such rich biodiversity

The post Explaining Brazil #283: Why you should care about Brazil’s Cerrado appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Why is Brazil a top target for cyberattacks?
description:
While criminals from abroad are targeting companies with more and more sophisticated attacks, homegrown hackers mainly run financial scams against individuals
